data.title: Reminds me of our visit to Mexico
data.text: The décor is awesome.  It really feels like you are miles away from it all.  People are very nice.  The warm tortilla chips and homemade Salsa they serve to you right away are a nice start to any meal.  Food is typical Mexican.  The real thing like they prepare it in Mexico.  so, if you like that taste and spice, you will like their food.

data.title: unique atmosphere, authnetic mexican food
data.text: I love the mission, I always get the shredded beef combination platter with rice and beans. It is located in an old church.

data.title: lovely atmosphere, don't get the scallops!
data.text:
Great atmosphere in very old church, artistic, beautiful.  Superb crab cake appetizer, best crab cakes in central NY.  We both ordered expensive scallop dish, which was very disappointing.  Crab cakes should be their main seafood entree, not scallops, based on our experience.  Scallop dish was $26 and included no salad or anything.  Scallops were at best so so, more like blah blah, dry dry.

However the restaurant is beautiful and artistic, regular Mexican is probably good, can't review that.  Flan is very good.

Worth trying, but can be busy.

data.title: Tasty and unique place
data.text: This church converted to colorful Mexican restaurant was a great find. The decor was delightfully eclectic and the food was solidly good. We had the house Sangria and one of the craft pumpkin beers to start. The enchilada tres queso was creamy and the double side of beans was ample. The mushroom enchilada was nicely seasoned.

data.title: Wow! Make the trip!
data.text:
This might be the best dinner I have had in Syracuse! The place is somewhat unassuming. An old church converted to a Pan-American (Mexican) restaurant. 
The guacamole is some of the best, but the quest fundido IS the best I have ever eaten. Get it...you won't regret it! 
Also save room for the flan! I know... I don't like flan either...BUT theirs is nothing short of a miracle in your mouth! 
I strongly recommend The Mission!

data.title: Quick, easy & delicious
data.text: We walked from the OnCenter and waited with a few other parties for the door to open at 5. One customer brought in flowers and a cake. Service was attentive, atmosphere very interesting.  Food was fresh, beautiful, generously sized and delicious.  Thanks to the previous reviewers who suggested the mango tea and gave us the heads up about reservations only accepted for groups of 7 or more. We ordered a large nacho plate for 4 people to share and when it was served we all thought it was going to need to be boxed.  So hearty and yummy there was no need for a box--until after entrees were served. Still, my one regret was that there was no dessert offered. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Mexican food in an interesting building
data.text: Outside of the restaurant it looks like a old church. It is not easily recognizable at a restaurant. More like a heritage building. Inside is the same for the ceiling and the tinted windows. Lovely historical place. Food is typical Mexican food and the taste is pretty authentic. Service is good and price is reasonable. Portions are good size so some ladies may have to prepare to pack left overs. Overall it is a good place that I don't mind visiting again.

data.title: Fantastic Mexican Food
data.text: I was hungry, I love Mexican Food - and celebrate a reunion with my former high school exchange family. Very cool place. Good food, very fresh, big junk for small money

data.title: Nice home cooking Mexican Meal
data.text: When ever we go to visit family in Canada, we make sure to stop here for lunch/diner. Until now we had diner and it was very good, last visit we went for lunch and it was disappointed. First of all its Mexican restaurant and they don't give complimentary chips and salsa every day. Food was lacking salt , our waitress was in so hurry that while we were working on food, she offered us to pack. Overall not good experience for lunch, and it was not that crowd that they want to move guest fast. For diner really recommend it.

data.title: Yummy Food
data.text: Sunday brunch was delicious- location is in a somewhat depressed and area- but this restaurant shows a great effort to renewing the neighborhood. Lovely decor and situated near a police station so you should feel safe. Host told me about the Underground Railroad connection- really neat spot to visit!!

data.title: Good Mexican food.
data.text: The food was good and the atmosphere was excellent.  The building is so deceiving on the outside.  It is an old church covered in ivy and not at all what you would expect when you step inside.  Service was quick for our large party.

data.title: Burrito
data.text: Went to Mission Restaurant for Sunday lunch.  From the outside we weren't sure that it was an actual restaurant, upon walking in we knew we were in the right place.  The menu was very descriptive in describing the different meals and sauces.  The burritos were very good, the mango iced tea was refreshing- we will definitely return

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: The atmosphere was fun, and the dining room was beautifully decorated with gorgeous stain glass windows. The food was fresh and delicious. Looks like a popular stop. I will go back.

data.title: Beautiful Restaurant
data.text: We didn't eat (unfortunately) as we had stopped in for drinks. The restaurant is in a former church and when the sun streams in through the stained glass windws it is just gorgeous. Service was excellent and the food smelled delicious. I can't wait to get back and actually have a meal!

data.title: good food great service!
data.text: We went to The Mission Saturday night. We called ahead for a reservation but they said they only take reservations for 7 or more. We got there about 730 and it was busy but crazy. We went to the bar and looked at the bar menu and  ordered a couple of Margaritas. I had a mango and the wife had a strawberry. They were very good. We were seated in about 10 minutes. The waitress brought us tortilla chips, salsa, sour cream and guacamole.. The salsa was good but in my opinion could use some heat but my wife said it was great. The guac was fresh and yummy. My wife ordered a bowl of Tortilla soup. She did not like it she said it was too salty. I tried it and I  liked it. My wife ordered a chicken buritto with black beans. It came with Spanish rice and the side. I order a special, it was a shirt steak with a great sauce on top of it. I cant remember what kind of sauce it was.  It came with yucca fries on the side. I ordered a side of Spanish rice too. Our entrees were great, I did not care for the yucca fries but everything else was great. The Spanish rice was very good. The steak was very flavorful and tender. I tried my wife's buritto that she couldn't finish and it was very very good. For dessert we tried the banana bread pudding. It had real good flavor but we did not care for the texture. I guess we are not bread pudding lovers. The waitress was great she was knowledgeable, attentive and had a great personality. You could tell she liked her job. When we ordered dessert we were not sure if we wanted to try the banana bread pudding or the lime pie. The waitress could tell we were not crazy about the bread pudding so she gave us a piece of lime pie. She just went and got it she didn't ask us she just did it. Waitresses, if you want a huge tip try this! One reason we don't go downtown a lot is because of the parking. We had no problem parking there. There were a lot of open spot within 100 yards of the Mission. If you like Mexican/Spanish food try it.

data.title: Fun atmosphere, average food
data.text: Attentive service, fun and inviting atmosphere, great selection of drinks and some craft beers....food good but more mediocre than not. Very close to campus in an old converted church whose basement once served as part of the underground railroad. Worth a visit if in town.

data.title: AMAZING Brunch!
data.text:
Came here before a show and had brunch, it was so delicious. 
I am a very picky eater so they swapped out a few ingredients for me no problem and it was delicious.
No chips and salsa a brunch though :(

data.title: Great food, pleasant atmosphere
data.text:
Nicely crafted menu: not as many choices as standard anything-combination places, but plenty of variety and specials. The chips & salsa & guacamole appetizer items were all fresh, nicely flavored & textured, and served at appropriate temperatures (for my taste).  
My duck entree (the special) was a plate of perfectly cooked duck in a nice fruit sauce (sauce quantity was just a bit skimpy), nicely balanced with roasted Brussels sprouts and a toothsome & tardy risotto. Effect was an almost-French sensibility of plate composition - thoughtfully considering tastes, textures, smells, appearance - using Mexican/Spanish flavored. It worked!
The Mexican coffee and flan special (Mexican chocolate) made a great finish.
Dining room is airy and cleverly decorated, making good use of the former church building.
Service was very friendly and gently attentive - as I like - and gave helpful advice.

data.title: Love it!!!
data.text: Love the food and the atmosphere is so unique!!! What a cool building, rich with history.  A must when visiting Syracuse.

data.title: Very authentic Mexican, with a different mix of dishes
data.text:
This is not your typical Americanized "plate of beans and rice" Mexican restaurant!  The menu obviously includes some of the more expected fare, but also some unexpected Mexican dishes that you won't normally find north of the border.  For example, I had a rice dish that also featured huitlacoche, which is a corn fungus that is often considered a delicacy in Mexico.  It has a wonderful garlic taste!  And although I've looked for it often, this is the first time that I've encountered it in a Mexican restaurant.  Another great dish is the Albóndigas, a Mexican meatball dish that is served as a starter, but could easily be an entree.  The seasoning and texture were absolutely wonderful!  The white sangria was also very, very good.

The Mission features a menu that changes seasonally, so you may find new delicacies at any time.

Service was fantastic.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable regarding ingredients and preparation, as well as being in the know on the history of the building, which according to our server (and the restaurant's web site) was "built in the 1840’s and formerly the Syracuse Wesleyan Methodist Church, was also an important 19th century way station on the Underground Railroad."

Highly recommended, and we will be back.
